title: Imposter Syndrome
description: You feel like a fraud at work, like you don't deserve your position or success. The doubt is overwhelming.
responses: Talk to your partner about these feelings
Remind yourself of your actual achievements
Consider if you need professional support

title: Difficult Boss
description: Your manager is making work life challenging - micromanaging, unclear expectations, or just personality clash.
responses: Try to address it professionally
Document issues in case you need them
Consider your options and timeline

title: Exciting Opportunity
description: A new opportunity appears - job offer, project, or chance to pivot. Exciting but requires a big decision.
responses: Discuss it thoroughly with your partner
Weigh the pros and cons carefully
Trust your instincts about what feels right

title: Recognition
description: Your work is recognized and appreciated. Praise, awards, or acknowledgment that feels genuinely earned.
responses: Accept it graciously
Share the win with your partner
Let it motivate you forward

title: Burnout Creeping
description: Work is demanding too much. Long hours, high pressure, no work-life balance. Something's got to change.
responses: Set firmer boundaries at work
Talk to your partner about the toll it's taking
Consider whether this job is sustainable

title: Passion Project
description: You get to work on something you actually care about. The work feels meaningful and energizing.
responses: Pour yourself into it
Share your excitement with your partner
Protect time for this meaningful work

title: Job Insecurity
description: Layoffs, restructuring, or just a sense that your position isn't secure. The uncertainty is stressful.
responses: Update your resume and network
Talk honestly with your partner about backup plans
Try to stay productive without panicking

title: Mentor Connection
description: You connect with someone who can guide your career growth. Their wisdom and support feel invaluable.
responses: Make the most of this relationship
Be open to their guidance
Consider how you might mentor others too

title: Skill Gap
description: You realize you're missing skills needed for where you want to go. Time to level up, but how?
responses: Make a learning plan
Discuss with your partner how to make time for it
See it as opportunity, not failure

title: Work-Life Win
description: You successfully negotiate better hours, remote work, or some other improvement to your work-life balance!
responses: Celebrate this victory
Use the improved balance wisely
Appreciate having advocated for yourself
